definition: candle light/candle-lit (vigil etc)/candela, unit of luminous intensity (cd)

sentences.english: What makes the candle blow so?
The candle light threw light onto the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 燭光把鏡照得光亮亮的。

sentences.english: I'd like a candlelight dinner, some dancing and to talk about our future.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一個燭光晚餐，跳跳舞，談談我們的未來。

sentences.english: Candle of the heart promising is only a comfort.
sentences.chinese: 燃一盞心燈，燭光下，明知道許願只是一種安慰。

sentences.english: You’re funny, charming, and good-looking in the candle light.
sentences.chinese: 約會的燭光下，帥氣的你表現得既幽默又迷人。
它們在燭光中油光發亮。

sentences.english: Treat your honey to a romantic dinner by candle-light.
sentences.chinese: 邀請戀人共進燭光晚餐。

sentences.english: The light given off one foot away from the flame of a candle is called "one candlepower."
sentences.chinese: 距離蠟燭火焰1英尺遠的光，叫“一個標準燭光”。

sentences.english: The light of a candle is dimmed by electric light.
sentences.chinese: 燭光與電燈光相比，前者就顯得暗淡無光了。

sentences.english: Women wearing the color red were also more likely to receive a prom invitation and be treated to a more expensive date or night out.
sentences.chinese: 着紅裝的女性也因此更易收到舞會或燭光晚餐的邀約。
突然就想到了任賢齊的《燭光》。

sentences.english: Candlelight vigils and community arts project are also scheduled tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天還將進行燭光守夜和社區藝術項目活動。

sentences.english: Nothing can strain your eyes so much as reading by the dim candle light.
sentences.chinese: 你看這種高雅的桌巾，它跟燭光晚宴非常相稱。

sentences.english: Another type of standard candle is a type of star called a Cepheid variable.
sentences.chinese: 另一種標準燭光是一種叫做造父變星的恆星。

definition: to illuminate/to turn on the lights/to light (a blaze)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
